at.falb.games.alcatraz.api

Class Alcatraz

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.falb.games.alcatraz.api.Alcatraz

  • public class Alcatraz
extends Object
    This class implements the game and provides methods to control the progress of the game.
    Author:
    falbj, Froihofer

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(int noPlayers,
                 int myPlayerId)
        Initializes the game. This is the first method to be called. You have to provide the number of players taking part in the game (has to be between 2 and 4) and the id of your player. Ids are starting by 0 and are ending by 3 for a four player game.
        If you want to start a new game you can initialize the game again with this method.
        Parameters:
        noPlayers - Number of players taking part in the game.
        myPlayerId - Id of your personal player.

      • start

        public void start()
        This should be the last method after complete preparation. It enables the player to do his move.

      • showWindow

        public void showWindow()
        Shows the window with the game board. It should be called after the init() method.

      • closeWindow

        public void closeWindow()
        Hides the window with the game board.

      • getWindow

        public JFrame getWindow()
        Returns the JFrame that displays the game board.

      • getGameBoard

        public JPanel getGameBoard()
        Returns the JPanel implementing the game board so that it can be used in a custom window.

      • disposeWindow

        public void disposeWindow()
        Destroys the game board. Call this method on exit if you exit the application by your program.

      • addMoveListener

        public void addMoveListener(MoveListener listener)
        Adds a MoveListener to the game. It is necessary to add atleast on listener to get informed on moves done by the player.
        Parameters:
        listener - MoveListener to add.

      • removeMoveListener

        public void removeMoveListener(MoveListener listener)
        Removes the specified MoveListener from the game.
        Parameters:
        listener - MoveListener to remove.

      • doMove

        public void doMove(Player player,
                   Prisoner prisoner,
                   int rowOrCol,
                   int row,
                   int col)
            throws IllegalMoveException
        This method can be called to move a prisoner. Use this method to do moves of other players received over the network.
        Parameters:
        player - The player which is moving his prisoner. This has to be the current player (otherwise nothing is done).
        prisoner - The prisoner to move.
        rowOrCol - Can be either ROW, COL, or BOAT
        row - The row to move to.
        col - The column to move to.
        Throws:
        IllegalMoveException - if a move is tried by the wrong player.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer(int playerId)
        Retrieves the player that corresponds to the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        playerId - Player ID to look up
        Returns:
        Returns the player corresponding to the ID.

      • getPrisoner

        public Prisoner getPrisoner(int prisonerId)
        Retrieves the prisoner that corresponds to the provided ID.
        Parameters:
        prisonerId - Prisoner ID to look up.
        Returns:
        Returns the prisoner corresponding to the ID.
